article.headline: (23) MARQUETTE 79, SAVANNAH ST 41
article.story: MILWAUKEE (AP) -- Scott Merritt scored 17 points and No. 23 Marquette defeated Savannah State 79-41 Friday night in the first round of the Blue & Gold Classic. Marquette (2-0) will try to win the tournament for the fifth straight year when it plays Valparaiso on Saturday night. Travis Diener scored 14 and Joe Chapman 13 for the Golden Eagles. In its season opener, Savannah State was led by Jamal Daniels with 11 points. Savannah State coach Ed Daniels was a member of Marquette's 1974 team, which lost to North Carolina State 76-64 in the NCAA championship game. Marquette jumped to a 16-3 lead when Merritt ended a 12-0 run with a pair of free throws. Merritt had eight points in the scoring surge. The Tigers trailed 37-15 at halftime and could never mount a comeback in the second half against the taller, quicker Golden Eagles.
